titles.title: To redesignate a Federal building located in Washington, D.C., as the "Sidney R. Yates Federal Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 695.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 9/28/1998--Passed House amended. Designates the Federal building located at 201 14th Street, SW. in Washington, D.C., and known as the Auditors Main Building, as the Sidney R. Yates Federal Building.
